Here is some quick (first time posting) DD on the upcoming Costco $COST earnings. Q1 2020 earnings will be reported on December 12.

  • US national retail sales slightly up over last 3 months but large household item sales declined (Trading Economics)
  • $TGT beat earnings when it reported a few weeks ago, ‘smashed’ sales analysts forecasts (CNBC)
  • $WMT also beat earnings at recent report (CNBC)
  • US consumer confidence is up, close to two year high (Trading Economics)
  • Costco reported over 6% growth in net sales for November YoY, and 5.6% growth in sales over the quarter. YoY sales for September and October also grew by between 5 and 6 percent.
  • Retail sales from many retail stores ($BBUY, $TGT) over US Thanksgiving/Black Friday/Cyber Monday period broke sales records (MarketWatch), but technical issues on Costco’s website reduced online sales for the company during this period.
  • P/E (35.8) trades high against comparables ($WMT: 26.85, $TGT 19.91)

Conclusion: bullish

Trade: Put credit spread 17Jan20 285/280

Dipping my toe into the earnings game. The short 285 leg is closer to ATM than I would normally play (30 delta), but I am pretty confident $COST will meet or beat earnings, so I am comfortable taking on a little more risk. The longer expiration time also provides some time for the price to recover if it dips post-earnings.
